New York Giants

My favorite team in the NFL

The timeline of the creation, rise, and fall of the New York Giants

  • 1925-The Giants were created and played in the Polo Grounds at Manhattan, New York.
  • 1956-The Giants moved to Yankee Stadium at The Bronx, New York
  • 1973-The Giants moved to Yale University stadium called Yale Bowl at New Haven, Connecticut
  • 1975-The Giants moved once again to Shea stadium at Flushing, Queens, New York
  • 1976-The Giants finally created their own stadium called Giants Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey
  • 1986-The Giants won their first Super Bowl championship aganist the Denver Broncos in a score of 39-20 in Rose Bowl at Pasadena, California
  • 1990-The Giants won their second Super Bowl championship aganist the Buffalo Bills in a score of 20-19 in Tampa Stadium at Tampa, Florida
  • 2007-The Giants won their third Super Bowl championship aganist the 18-0 New England Patriots in a score of 17-14 in University of Phoenix stadium at Glendale, Arizona
  • 2010-The Giants moved to their current home of Metlife Stadium at East Rutherford, New Jersey
  • 2011-The Gianrs won their fourth Super Bowl championship aganist the New England Patriots in a score of 21-17 in Lucas Oil stadium at Indianapolis, Indiana
  • 2012-present-The Giants have been to one playoff apperance and lost many football games to this day.
Wikipedia Entry
